citation.article-title: Shinella granuli gen. nov., sp. nov., and proposal of the reclassification of Zoogloea ramigera ATCC 19623 as Shinella zoogloeoides sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Shinella zoogloeoides sp. nov.
Shinella zoogloeoides (zoo.gloe.o′i.des. N.L. n. Zoogloea bacterial genus name; Gr. suff. -oides similar to; N.L. adj. zoogloeoides similar to Zoogloea).

The description is as given for the genus and by Shin et al. (1993) and Rosselló-Mora et al. (1993), with the addition that it is negative in tests for amylase, protease, lipase, cellulose, xylanase, DNase, gelatinase and urease.

Does not utilize adipate, alanine, arginine, caparate, citrate, glycogen, gluconate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, malate, malonate, melibiose, phenylacetate, salicin, suberate or valerate.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 (13·4 %), 3-OH C16 : 0 (8·1 %), C18 : 0 (2·6 %), C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c (2·9 %) and summed feature 7 (72·9 %; C18 : 1ω7c/ω9t/ω12t, C18 : 1ω7c/ω9c/ω12t).
The major respiratory quinone is Q-10.
The type strain, ATCC 19623T (=IAM 12669T=I-16-MT), was isolated from sewage treatment systems.
